channel.title: Perl Weekly #517
channel.description: Hand-picked news and articles about Perl - Made with love by TabHub(https://tabhub.io)

item.title: PAUSE workaround
item.description: PAUSE parses the text in your code to see which modules you provide. Unfortunately that means it also includes names that are only mentioned in the documentation or in strings that never get executed. This can lead to unpleasant side-effects. How can you avoid these?
item.author: flavio_poletti

item.title: The real PAUSE workaround
item.description: The real PAUSE workaround
item.author: flavio_poletti

item.title: Data visualization: Creating charts using REST API's in React.js
item.description: Part of the MojoReactApp-OpenAPI series.
item.author: gaurav_rai

item.title: 4 Steps to Blogging Outside the Perl Bubble
item.description: Mark has been one of the most prolific writers about Perl recently. You might want to listen to him.
item.author: mark_gardner

item.title: More robust self-recursion
item.description: More robust self-recursion
item.author: flavio_poletti

item.title: Plot data on the terminal
item.description: Plot data on the terminal
item.author: flavio_poletti

item.title: The Perl echo chamber, marketing and ... is Perl really dying?
item.description: here
item.author: cosimo_streppone

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 118
item.description: Welcome a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Binary Palindrome" and "Adventure of Knight". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read FAQ page.
item.author: mohammad_anwar

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 117
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Missing Rows" and "Find Possible Paths" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
item.author: mohammad_anwar

item.title: A List with One Missing Line and Too Many Lines to List: The Weekly Challenge 117
item.description: Credit must be given to Adam for printing the structured triangle and introducing the Qauntam Pascal Triangle. Thanks for sharing.
item.author: adam_russell

item.title: The Rowdy Path with Raku and Perl
item.description: Ever since Arne started sharing Perl solutions alongside Raku, I really enjoy the translation of Raku to get the Perl equivalent. Great work. Keep it up.
item.author: arne_sommer

item.title: Who Went Missing on the Triangular Tour?
item.description: As always, Colin's story behind each task is priceless, you don't want to miss thid. He is simply the best. Keep it going. Thanks.
item.author: colin_crain

item.title: PWC117 - Missing Row
item.description: Flavio's regex magic for the Missing Rows task is mindblowing. It took me some time to understand it. Thanks for sharing.
item.author: flavio_poletti

item.title: PWC117 - Find Possible Paths
item.description: Flavio's extensive discussion of the Find Possible Paths task is something you don't want to miss. It is the kind of discussion I always look for in a PWC blog. Thank you Flavio.
item.author: flavio_poletti

item.title: Trees and Rows: Perl Weekly Challenge 117
item.description: I loved the fact that Dave is generating the input file on the fly. Nice hack. Also his idea of re-using his past solution and extending it to get the task done. Very clever approach.
item.author: dave_jacoby

item.title: Perl Challenge 117 Redux: Permutations!
item.description: This is a bonus blog post from Dave to give a detailed analysis of the task Find Possible Paths. Thanks for the post.
item.author: dave_jacoby

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 117
item.description: I loved the explanation of Find Possible Paths solution. It is easy to follow for any layman. Thanks for your efforts. BTW congratulations on the second anniversay of your blogging.
item.author: jaldhar_vyas

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge #117
item.description: I always look for James's solution and his story behind the solution. He is so good at looking beyond the task and giving his opinions. I simply loved it. Keep it going.
item.author: james_smith

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 117: Missing Row and Possible Paths
item.description: Laurent presented us with short and precise solutions this week, specially the solution to the Find Possible Paths task. He made it look so simple. Great work, thanks for sharing.
item.author: laurent_rosenfeld

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 117: quick and dirty
item.description: Luca's Raku solution to the Find Possible Paths task is my favourite this week. The code looks elegant. Thanks for your efforts.
item.author: luca_ferrari

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 117
item.description: Luis showed the power of recursive functions when dealing with Find Possible Paths task. Nice and easy to follow, thanks.
item.author: luis_mochan

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 117: Missing Possibilities
item.description: I loved the graphical representation of the Find Possible Paths task. It helped a lot to understand the solution. Thanks for all your hard work.
item.author: roger_bell_west

item.title: Weekly Challenge 117
item.description: Thanks, Simon, for talking about Shroder Number. I didn't know about it. I learn so much by just reading the blogs by Team PWC. Thank you for your effort.
item.author: simon_green
